intro: Zigadenus venenosus var. micranthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved death camis, is a toxic plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellowish-green flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant contains potent toxins, including steroidal alkaloids, which can be lethal if ingested. It typically grows in moist, open areas such as meadows and forest edges. Due to its high toxicity, it is important to avoid contact or consumption of any part of this plant.
